* Regions of Delivery: Saskatchewan

## Project Overview

Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) requires a contractor for technical support at the Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Program (CAPMoN) Bratt's Lake site in Saskatchewan. The site is part of ECCC's national network of CAPMoN stations and is used to collect weekly precipitation and/or air samples.

## Key Responsibilities

* Attend to the station to retrieve and process samples according to CAPMoN Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
* Read and record various gauges, diagnostics, and perform regular servicing, troubleshooting, and minor repairs
* Package and ship samples for analysis to the CAPMoN National Laboratory located in Toronto, Ontario

## Security Requirements

* There is a security requirement associated with this requirement

## Contract Period

* The period of the contract is from the date of contract to December 31, 2024 inclusive

## Extension Option

* The contractor grants to Canada the irrevocable option to extend the term of the contract by up to two (2) additional one (1) year period(s) under the same conditions
